wiki_catalogs.name: Getting Started
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive content for the Getting Started section focused on the cartwrightking-admin-erp application. Explain the purpose of the admin ERP system, its core features, and intended user roles. Provide step-by-step instructions for setting up the development environment, including required tools (Node.js, pnpm), dependency installation, and environment configuration. Include instructions for running the application in development and production modes. Demonstrate basic navigation through the login flow and dashboard interface using real code examples from the App Router and authentication components. Document prerequisites such as TypeScript, Next.js, and React knowledge. Address common setup issues like dependency conflicts, environment variable misconfiguration, and authentication token handling. Include performance tips for local development and debugging strategies for common startup errors.

wiki_catalogs.name: Login System
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the Login System sub-feature. Explain the implementation of the login flow from the login page component through the login form, React Hook Form with Zod validation, and submission handling. Document how user credentials are securely transmitted via the auth service using axios, including request payload structure and error handling for invalid credentials. Include code examples showing form state management, validation schema definition, and success/error state transitions. Describe integration with the global auth context and how successful login triggers session initialization and redirect. Address common issues such as incorrect password handling, network failures, and UX improvements for accessibility. Provide best practices for securing login forms against common vulnerabilities like XSS and brute force attempts.

wiki_catalogs.name: Component Architecture
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create architectural documentation for the component-driven architecture of the cartwrightking-admin-erp application. Describe the organization of UI components by feature domain and the role of shared UI primitives from shadcn/ui and Radix UI. Explain the layout hierarchy starting from root App component through admin and auth layouts, detailing how layout propagation works in Next.js App Router. Document the structure of reusable components in the src/components directory, including layout components (sidebar, topbar, footer), data display tables, forms, and modals. Illustrate how component composition enables consistent UI patterns across dashboard modules. Include examples of component usage from actual pages like dashboard, company-hub, and org-chart. Address responsive design considerations using use-mobile.ts and accessibility patterns implemented via UI library components. Provide guidance on creating new components following existing conventions.

wiki_catalogs.name: Company Hub
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the Company Hub feature. Thoroughly explain its implementation as the central module for managing company-wide information and employee records. Document the page structure, form handling via company-hub-form.tsx, and integration with employee data services. Include usage patterns for viewing, creating, and editing company information with real examples from the codebase. Explain the routing strategy using dynamic [id] parameters and the creation flow via the 'new' route. Detail how data is fetched using custom hooks and persisted through service layer calls. Address common issues such as form validation errors and data loading states, providing solutions based on actual implementation. Make content accessible to beginners while including technical depth on state synchronization and error handling for experienced developers.

wiki_catalogs.name: Form Components
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create detailed documentation for form-related UI components including form wrappers, inputs, textareas, checkboxes, radio groups, selects, comboboxes, file dropzones, and rich text editors. Explain how these components integrate with React Hook Form and Zod validation schema, using examples from executive-member-form.tsx and new-hire-plan-form.tsx. Document all props, events, and styling customization options via Tailwind CSS and shadcn/ui composition patterns. Include accessibility features such as label binding, error messaging, and keyboard navigation. Provide usage examples for complex form scenarios like dynamic field arrays and conditional rendering. Address performance considerations when handling large forms and strategies for error handling and user feedback using sonner notifications.

wiki_catalogs.name: Data Fetching with React Query
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the data fetching mechanism using @tanstack/react-query. Explain how useDepartments, useExecutiveMembers, and similar hooks abstract API calls into declarative data fetching patterns. Document the integration between custom hooks and service layer functions, including error handling, loading states, and automatic refetching behavior. Include concrete examples showing useQuery in page components to load paginated and filtered data. Detail the configuration of query keys, stale time, and caching strategies. Address common issues such as over-fetching, unnecessary re-renders, and handling dependent queries. Provide best practices for query prefetching and hydration from server components. Make content accessible to beginners while offering advanced insights into query optimization and cache invalidation patterns.

wiki_catalogs.name: View Company Information
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the Company Hub's view functionality. Explain how the page.tsx file renders the list of company information and uses dynamic routing with [id] to display detailed records. Document the integration with useEmployees hook to fetch and display employee data within company profiles. Include examples of data rendering patterns, loading states, and error handling from the actual implementation. Describe the role of company-hub-form.tsx in read-only mode for displaying structured data. Address common issues such as slow data loading or missing employee references, and provide solutions based on the codebase's use of React Query caching and fallback rendering. Make the content beginner-friendly with clear explanations of data flow while offering advanced insights into performance optimization and state management.

wiki_catalogs.name: Departments List
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the Departments List feature. Explain the implementation of the paginated departments table using card-table.tsx and departments-table.tsx components. Document the data fetching process via useDepartments hook and its integration with React Query for caching and revalidation. Include examples from the codebase showing how query parameters and pagination are handled. Describe the table toolbar, search functionality, and sorting mechanisms using table-search.tsx and sorting-dropdown.tsx. Illustrate how row actions are implemented and how the table interacts with the detail view via dynamic routing. Address common issues such as loading states, empty states, and performance optimization for large datasets. Provide guidance on customizing column visibility and integrating additional filters.

wiki_catalogs.name: List Executive Members
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the Executive Members listing feature. Explain how the page at page.tsx renders a comprehensive table of all executive members using executive-members-table.tsx, including columns for name, role, contact information, and profile image. Document the integration with use-executive-members hook to fetch data via the GET /api/executives/executives/ endpoint from executive-members.ts service. Highlight pagination, sorting, and search capabilities powered by React Query and card-table components. Include examples of data loading states and error handling. Address performance considerations for large datasets and accessibility features in the table design. Provide guidance on customizing the table columns and integrating additional actions.

wiki_catalogs.name: Document Management
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the document management functionality within the Knowledge Base. Explain how the KnowledgeBaseTable component renders structured data using TanStack Table with sortable columns for Folder, Created By, Access Level, and Date Created. Document the use of CardTableColumnHeader for sortable headers and row-level actions via the Actions column. Detail the implementation of row pinning using usePinnedRows hook and navigation to folder-specific views via router.push. Include examples of table toolbar features like search and sorting. Address common issues such as stale data display and sorting inconsistencies, referencing React.useEffect synchronization logic. Provide guidance on extending the table with new columns or custom cell renderers while maintaining performance.

wiki_catalogs.name: Plan Creation
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the Training Checklists creation process. Explain how the NewHirePlanForm component enables HR administrators to create structured onboarding plans by assigning employees and defining task and training checklists. Document the integration with useEmployees hook to fetch and display selectable employee data, including avatar rendering and department information. Detail the form's state management for assignees and checklist items, and explain how SelectableTags facilitates multi-selection of employees. Include practical examples of form usage, employee data mapping from API responses, and dynamic initialization of task/training checklists. Address common issues such as employee list loading delays or selection persistence, providing solutions based on React.useMemo optimizations and state synchronization patterns observed in the codebase. Make content accessible to HR users while offering technical depth for developers customizing the assignment logic or extending form fields.

wiki_catalogs.name: Org Chart Visualization
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the Org Chart visualization feature. Explain how the organizational hierarchy is rendered using interactive employee profile cards and tabular data views. Document the use of recursive component patterns to display nested reporting structures and the integration of avatar stacks and tooltips for enhanced user experience. Detail the responsive layout strategies that adapt the chart view for desktop and mobile devices. Include examples from employee-profile-card.tsx showing how data is passed and displayed, and explain the role of employee-table.tsx in providing a structured alternative view. Address performance considerations when rendering large hierarchies, referencing pagination and virtualization techniques if present. Provide guidance on customizing the visual appearance using Tailwind CSS and component props.

wiki_catalogs.name: Architecture Overview
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create architectural documentation for the cartwrightking-admin-erp application. Describe the high-level design based on Next.js 15 App Router with React 19, emphasizing the component-driven architecture and separation of concerns. Document the key architectural patterns: React Context for authentication state management, React Query for data fetching and caching, and service-layer abstraction for API communication. Explain the role of middleware in authentication flow and route protection. Illustrate system boundaries between frontend components, API services, and backend integration. Include infrastructure requirements, scalability considerations, and deployment topology. Provide a system context diagram showing component interactions, data flows, and integration points. Address cross-cutting concerns including security (JWT, cookie-based auth), error handling, and performance optimization. Document technology stack decisions, third-party dependencies, and version compatibility between core libraries.

wiki_catalogs.name: Token Refresh Mechanism
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the Token Refresh Mechanism. Explain how expired JWT tokens are automatically refreshed using silent background requests via axios interceptors. Document the implementation of token expiration checks, refresh token storage, and retry logic for failed requests due to expired tokens. Include code examples from api.ts showing the interceptor setup, refresh flow orchestration, and concurrent request queuing during refresh. Describe integration with the auth context and React Query to ensure seamless user experience without requiring re-login. Address edge cases such as invalid refresh tokens, network outages during refresh, and race conditions. Provide debugging strategies and logging practices for monitoring token lifecycle. Highlight security considerations including refresh token rotation and secure storage.

wiki_catalogs.name: State Management System
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the state management architecture in cartwrightking-admin-erp. Explain the dual approach: React Context API for global authentication state and React Query for server state management. Detail how AuthContext provides session data, token refresh functionality, and user permissions across the application. Document the integration between useAuth hook and authentication flow, including token persistence via cookies.ts. Describe how React Query's useQuery and useMutation hooks manage data synchronization for departments, employees, and other entities. Illustrate the interaction between custom hooks in src/hooks/queries, service layer functions, and the API client. Include examples of state transitions during login, logout, and token refresh. Address common issues like stale data, loading states, and error handling in queries. Provide best practices for consuming state in components and optimizing re-renders.

wiki_catalogs.name: Departments
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the Departments module. Explain its role in organizing the company structure by functional units. Document the implementation of the departments table, detail view, and modal-based creation interface. Include concrete examples from departments-table.tsx and new-department-modal.tsx to illustrate component composition and interaction. Detail the API integration through departments.ts service and data fetching via use-departments hook. Explain routing using dynamic [id] segments and state management for table views. Address common issues like hierarchical data display and form submission handling, referencing actual code patterns. Provide guidance on extending the module for additional department attributes or workflows.

wiki_catalogs.name: Data Display Components
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for data display components used across dashboard modules. Document implementation details of card layouts, data tables, avatars, avatar stacks, badges, progress indicators, charts, and skeleton loaders. Use real examples from employee-ring-chart.tsx, stat-cards.tsx, and executive-members-table.tsx to illustrate usage patterns. Explain how table components support sorting, pagination, and responsive design through integration with card-table-column-header.tsx and card-table-pagination.tsx. Detail accessibility features including ARIA labels and screen reader support. Include customization options for theming via CSS variables and responsive breakpoints. Address performance optimization techniques for rendering large datasets using virtualization concepts and loading states.

wiki_catalogs.name: Data Mutations and State Updates
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for data mutation operations using React Query's useMutation hook. Explain how create, update, and delete actions are implemented across entities like departments and executive members. Document the flow from UI form submission through hook invocation, service call, and cache invalidation. Include examples of optimistic updates, rollback strategies on error, and mutation result handling via onSuccess callbacks. Detail integration with React Hook Form and Zod validation during mutation preparation. Address common issues such as mutation race conditions, partial failures, and synchronizing local state with server response. Provide debugging techniques for tracking mutation status and error payloads. Offer performance tips for minimizing re-renders during mutation transitions.

wiki_catalogs.name: Create New Company Record
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the Company Hub's creation workflow. Thoroughly explain the implementation in the 'new' route page.tsx, focusing on form initialization and submission handling via company-hub-form.tsx. Document how the form collects company information and integrates with employee data through the useEmployees hook for selection inputs. Include a step-by-step breakdown of the form submission process, from validation using React Hook Form and Zod to API persistence via the service layer. Provide concrete code examples showing default values, field constraints, and success/error feedback mechanisms. Explain how the employees service is used to populate dropdowns and validate relationships. Address common issues such as validation failures or API errors, referencing actual error handling patterns in the codebase. Balance beginner guidance on form usage with advanced topics like async validation and optimistic UI updates.

wiki_catalogs.name: Department Detail View
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the Department Detail View. Explain the implementation of the dynamic route [id] in page.tsx and how it retrieves department-specific data. Document the structure and presentation of detailed department information using departments-detail-table.tsx, including employee listings and organizational hierarchy. Describe the data flow from the page component to the UI, emphasizing state management and error handling for invalid or missing department IDs. Include examples of how the detail view enhances the user experience with structured data display and contextual actions. Address common issues such as data consistency, loading sequences, and navigation back to the list. Provide guidance on extending the detail view with additional tabs or related data sections.

wiki_catalogs.name: View Executive Member Details
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for viewing individual executive member details. Explain how the [id]/page.tsx route fetches a specific executive's data using the useExecutive hook which calls the GET /api/executives/executives/{id}/ API endpoint. Document the use of executive-member-detail-table.tsx to display comprehensive profile information including personal details, education, and role. Describe breadcrumb navigation, loading states, and error handling for invalid IDs. Include how the profile image is rendered and managed. Provide examples of integrating additional detail sections and ensuring responsive layout. Address caching strategies via React Query and data consistency mechanisms.

wiki_catalogs.name: Folder Organization
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for folder organization in the Knowledge Base. Explain the implementation of hierarchical routing using [...slug] to support nested folder navigation. Document the AddFolderModal component's form structure, including folder name input, access control via radio buttons (Only You, Specific People, Specific Department), and dynamic tag selection with SelectableTags. Detail state management for access type and selected entities (people/departments). Describe integration with user and department data sources through createSelectableItems utility. Include usage of AppModal for consistent UI presentation. Address common issues like invalid folder names, access control misconfigurations, and UI state leaks. Provide best practices for validating folder creation inputs and handling edge cases such as empty selections or duplicate names.

wiki_catalogs.name: Checklist Management
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the checklist management system within the Training Checklists feature. Explain how ChecklistCard organizes tasks and trainings into two distinct categories using the variant prop, and how it manages item state through React.useState. Document the interaction flow where clicking the add button opens NewTaskModal, allowing users to input title, detail, and attachments for new checklist items. Detail the onCreate callback mechanism that generates timestamp-based IDs to prevent SSR/CSR mismatches and prepends new items to the list. Describe how ChecklistItem renders individual entries with delete functionality via handleDelete. Include examples of rich text editing with RichTextEditor and file attachment handling via Dropzone. Address common issues such as lost edits during modal dismissal or duplicate item creation, providing solutions based on controlled component patterns and state update batching seen in the codebase. Make content intuitive for HR administrators while giving developers insight into state management strategies and extensibility points for validation or item reordering.

wiki_catalogs.name: Employee Management
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the employee management functionality within the Org Chart module. Explain the implementation of viewing, creating, and editing employee records through dynamic routing with [id] parameters and form-based interactions. Document the use of org-chart-form.tsx for unified create/edit operations, including field validation with Zod and form state management via react-hook-form. Detail how the use-employees hook integrates with React Query to fetch, mutate, and cache employee data, ensuring real-time consistency across views. Illustrate the data flow from UI input to API service call via employees.ts, highlighting error handling and loading states. Provide practical examples of form usage and describe how relationships like manager-subordinate are established and validated to prevent circular references.

wiki_catalogs.name: Authentication System
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the Authentication System sub-feature. Thoroughly explain the implementation of login, token refresh, and session management using cookie-based JWT authentication. Document the invocation relationship between the login form, auth context, React Query hooks, and auth service. Detail the domain model for User and Session, including token storage and expiration handling. Include concrete examples from the actual codebase showing form validation with React Hook Form and Zod, API calls via axios interceptors, and context state updates. Explain configuration options for token refresh intervals and redirect logic. Address common issues such as expired sessions, failed token refresh, and concurrent request handling. Provide solutions for debugging authentication flow and monitoring token lifecycle. Make content accessible to beginners while providing sufficient technical depth for experienced developers regarding security best practices.

wiki_catalogs.name: Session Management
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for Session Management. Explain how user sessions are established, maintained, and terminated using cookie-based JWT authentication. Document the role of the AuthContext in managing session state across components, including login, logout, and session persistence on page reload. Detail the implementation of middleware.ts in protecting routes and validating session cookies on the server side. Include code examples showing context provider setup, session expiration handling, and logout functionality that clears tokens and redirects appropriately. Address integration with React Query for cache invalidation on logout. Discuss security aspects such as HTTP-only cookies, secure flag usage, and CSRF protection. Provide troubleshooting guidance for common session-related issues like persistent login after logout or unexpected session drops.

wiki_catalogs.name: Data Flow and API Integration
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive documentation for the data flow architecture and API integration patterns in the application. Describe the layered approach: components  custom hooks  service layer  apiCaller  HTTP client. Explain the role of api.ts as the centralized Axios instance with interceptors for authentication and error handling, including automatic token refresh logic. Detail how api-caller.ts abstracts request formatting for both JSON and FormData payloads. Document the service layer organization by domain (auth, departments, employees, etc.) and their exported functions. Illustrate the complete data flow for a typical CRUD operation using an example from executive-members or departments module. Include sequence diagrams showing client-server interactions, error recovery paths, and caching behavior via React Query. Address security considerations in API communication, request cancellation, and performance optimization through query deduplication and pagination utils.

wiki_catalogs.name: Executive Members
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the Executive Members feature. Explain its purpose in managing leadership team profiles with CRUD operations. Document the implementation of listing, detailed views, editing, and creation flows using page.tsx files under executive-members routes. Highlight the use of executive-member-form.tsx for data entry and validation, and executive-members-table.tsx for data display. Detail integration with executive-members.ts service and use-executive-members hook for data synchronization. Include examples of file upload handling for profile pictures and form state management. Address common issues such as role-based access control and image upload failures, referencing actual error handling patterns in the codebase.

wiki_catalogs.name: Navigation Components
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive documentation for navigation components that enable user movement across the admin dashboard. Cover sidebar navigation, top-level menus, breadcrumbs, tabbed interfaces, pagination controls, command palettes, and menubars. Reference implementations in admin-sidebar.tsx, admin-topbar.tsx, and layout.tsx to demonstrate integration patterns. Document keyboard navigation, focus management, and mobile responsiveness. Explain how these components maintain active state and URL synchronization in Next.js App Router. Include theming options and customization through Tailwind classes. Provide guidance on accessibility compliance including landmark roles and screen reader announcements. Address common issues like menu clipping and z-index conflicts.

wiki_catalogs.name: Pagination System
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the pagination system used throughout the application. Explain the implementation of offset-based pagination using page numbers and limit parameters, as handled in pagination-utils.ts. Document how pagination controls are rendered and managed via card-table-pagination and integrated with data fetching hooks. Include examples of constructing paginated API requests and processing meta information from responses. Detail the user interface behavior, including page navigation, item count display, and disabled states. Address common issues such as incorrect page resets after filtering, boundary edge cases, and performance implications of large datasets. Provide guidance on extending the system for cursor-based or infinite scrolling patterns in the future.

wiki_catalogs.name: Edit Existing Company Record
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for editing company records in the Company Hub. Explain how the [id] dynamic route loads existing data and populates the company-hub-form.tsx component for modification. Document the data fetching process using React Query via useEmployees and other relevant hooks, including loading, error, and success states. Include examples of form pre-filling, field validation, and PATCH/PUT submission patterns from the actual implementation. Describe how the form handles both company metadata and associated employee relationships during updates. Address common issues such as stale data, concurrent edits, and form dirty state management, providing solutions based on the codebase's use of React Query's refetching and form state tracking. Make the content accessible to beginners with clear workflow diagrams while including technical depth on mutation strategies and conflict resolution for experienced developers.

wiki_catalogs.name: Create Department
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the Create Department functionality. Explain the implementation of the modal-based form in new-department-modal.tsx, including its integration with React Hook Form and Zod validation schema. Document the submission flow, from form validation to API call via createDepartment in departments.ts service, and cache invalidation using React Query. Include code examples showing how the modal is triggered from the toolbar and how success/error states are handled. Describe the user experience considerations, such as input feedback, loading indicators, and error messaging. Address common issues like duplicate submissions, validation edge cases, and accessibility compliance. Provide guidance on extending the form with additional fields or integrating with other services like branch selection or manager assignment.

wiki_catalogs.name: Edit Executive Member Profile
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for editing executive member profiles. Analyze the implementation in [id]/edit/page.tsx that pre-fills the executive-member-form.tsx with existing data fetched via useExecutive hook from the GET /api/executives/executives/{id}/ endpoint. Document form validation using Zod and React Hook Form, including handling text fields and file uploads. Explain the PUT/PATCH update flow through the executive-members.ts service to the /api/executives/executives/{id}/ endpoint. Detail the submit handler pattern using onRegisterSubmit callback and button integration. Cover image upload and deletion via dedicated endpoints, including error handling for failed uploads and network issues. Provide best practices for form state management and UX feedback.

wiki_catalogs.name: File Uploads
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for file upload functionality in the Knowledge Base. Explain the AddFileModal component's integration with Dropzone for multi-file selection of PDF and Office documents. Document the use of useUploadQueue hook to enqueue files via enqueueFiles, which manages background uploads. Describe the UploadQueue component's role in displaying real-time upload progress, success, and error states with visual progress bars and status indicators. Detail the collapsed/expanded state management and clear/remove actions. Explain how api-caller.ts handles FormData submissions for file uploads and how branches.ts service may provide target path context. Address common issues like upload failures, partial uploads, and large file handling. Provide optimization tips for upload batching, error recovery, and UX improvements for slow connections.

wiki_catalogs.name: Task Handling
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the task handling mechanism in the Training Checklists system. Focus on the NewTaskModal component's role in creating both tasks and training items through its type prop, demonstrating conditional rendering for titles, descriptions, and labels. Document the component's props interface (NewTaskModalProps) and its integration with AppModal for consistent UI presentation, including icon, title, and action button handling. Explain the internal state management for title and detail fields, along with the confirmation workflow that triggers the onCreate callback and closes the modal. Detail the use of RichTextEditor for formatted task descriptions and Dropzone for supporting multiple file types (images, PDFs, Excel files). Provide examples of how this modal is invoked from ChecklistCard and how it maintains context via closure over the variant type. Address common issues such as uncontrolled editor state or attachment upload failures, offering solutions based on controlled component patterns and error boundary usage as implied by the UI component design. Make content practical for HR users while equipping developers to extend the modal with additional fields or validation rules.

wiki_catalogs.name: Structural Editing
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive content for structural editing capabilities in the Org Chart. Explain how users can modify reporting lines, reassign teams, and adjust hierarchical positions through dedicated edit interfaces. Document the implementation in [id]/edit/page.tsx, focusing on the form workflow and submission handling. Describe how drag-and-drop or table-based reorganization is supported in employee-table.tsx, including UI feedback during reordering. Detail backend integration via employees.ts service to persist structural changes, emphasizing transaction safety and validation logic that prevents invalid organizational states. Include examples of success and error handling, and discuss strategies for confirming destructive changes using confirm-popover.tsx. Address scalability for large-scale edits and potential batch update patterns.

wiki_catalogs.name: Dashboard Modules
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive content for the Dashboard Modules section focused on the administrative interface. Explain the purpose, architecture, and relationship of each dashboard module to the overall ERP system. Document the implementation details of the dashboard layout, navigation structure, and state management. Include configuration options for dashboard customization and theming. Provide practical examples demonstrating how users interact with different modules through the sidebar and topbar navigation. Show how stat cards and charts visualize key metrics using real data from the API. Document public interfaces for dashboard components, their props, and event handling patterns. Include diagrams illustrating the component hierarchy and data flow from API to UI. Address performance considerations for rendering multiple data visualizations and optimizing re-renders.

wiki_catalogs.name: Routing and Navigation System
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create architectural documentation for the routing and navigation system based on Next.js 15 App Router. Explain the file-based routing structure with route groups (admin, auth) and dynamic segments ([id], [...slug]). Detail how layout components provide nested layouts with proper segmentation between authenticated and public routes. Document the role of middleware.ts in authentication guard logic, redirecting unauthenticated users from admin routes to login. Describe the route configuration in routes.ts and its usage across the application. Illustrate the navigation flow from login to dashboard and between dashboard modules. Include examples of link creation using Next.js Link component and programmatic navigation. Address SEO implications, route loading states, and error handling for invalid routes. Provide guidelines for adding new routes and protecting private routes.

wiki_catalogs.name: Knowledge Base
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the Knowledge Base module. Explain its role as a document and file management system within the ERP. Document the implementation of hierarchical navigation using [...slug] dynamic routing, folder and file creation via modals, and upload queue management. Include usage of knowledge-base-table.tsx for displaying structured content and row-context-menus.tsx for inline actions. Detail integration with file upload APIs through api-caller.ts and branch management via branches.ts service. Provide examples of drag-and-drop interactions and batch operations. Address common issues like upload failures, permission errors, and large file handling, referencing actual implementation strategies in upload-queue.tsx.

wiki_catalogs.name: Feedback & Overlay Components
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed documentation for UI components that provide user feedback and overlay content, including alerts, dialogs, drawers, sheets, popovers, toasts, tooltips, and modals. Use app-modal.tsx and confirm-popover.tsx as primary examples to illustrate custom wrapper patterns around base shadcn/ui components. Document lifecycle events, trigger mechanisms, and animation behaviors powered by Tailwind transitions. Explain accessibility features such as focus trapping, escape key dismissal, and ARIA live regions. Include integration patterns with React Query mutations for success/error feedback using sonner notifications. Provide examples of confirmation dialogs from delete operations in departments-table.tsx and executive-members-table.tsx. Address stacking context issues and mobile adaptation strategies.

wiki_catalogs.name: Search and Filtering
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the search and filtering capabilities within data tables. Explain how table-search enables real-time text filtering and how sorting-dropdown provides column-based sort controls. Document the propagation of search and sort parameters from UI components to query hooks and ultimately to API requests. Include examples of debounced search input handling and state management of filter criteria. Detail backend integration through API query parameters and case-insensitive filtering logic. Address common issues such as delayed search feedback, incorrect parameter encoding, and maintaining filter state across page navigation. Provide optimization tips for reducing network requests during active typing and ensuring accessibility compliance for filter controls.

wiki_catalogs.name: Create New Executive Member
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for creating new executive members. Explain how the new/page.tsx route initializes an empty form using executive-member-form.tsx with no initialValues. Document the form submission flow that sends a POST request to /api/executives/executives/ via the createExecutive function in executive-members.ts service. Highlight integration with React Hook Form and Zod validation to ensure data integrity before submission. Describe success handling including navigation to the detail page upon creation and error handling for duplicate entries or validation failures. Include file upload handling for profile pictures during creation. Provide guidance on default field values and conditional logic within the form.

wiki_catalogs.name: Context Menus
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for context menus in the Knowledge Base. Explain the implementation of inline action menus within table rows, including Delete and Pin actions. Document how row-context-menus.tsx integrates with PinRowButton to manage pinned state persistence and visual feedback. Detail the use of Button with Trash2 icon for deletion actions and its placement within the Actions column. Describe event propagation handling to prevent unwanted row navigation when clicking action buttons. Address common issues such as menu overlap, accessibility concerns with icon-only buttons, and state synchronization between pinning UI and data layer. Provide guidance on extending context menus with additional actions like Share or Move while maintaining clean UI/UX patterns.

wiki_catalogs.name: API Reference
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create API documentation for the cartwrightking-admin-erp application's internal API client and service layer. Document the HTTP methods, URL patterns, request/response schemas, and authentication methods used across all endpoints. For each service (auth, departments, employees, executive-members, branches), specify the available operations, parameters, and return types based on the actual implementation. Explain the wrapper pattern used in apiCaller for handling both JSON and FormData requests. Document the axios interceptor setup for automatic token injection and refresh logic. Include protocol-specific examples for file uploads and form submissions. Address error handling strategies, retry mechanisms, and rate limiting considerations. Provide client implementation guidelines for consuming these services in new components. Include performance optimization tips such as query key structuring and cache invalidation patterns. Add security considerations around token exposure and request validation.

wiki_catalogs.name: Form Handling and Validation
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed documentation for the form handling architecture using React Hook Form with Zod validation. Explain the integration pattern between form components and Zod schemas, including type safety from API types in api.d.ts. Document the structure of complex forms like company-hub-form and executive-member-form, highlighting reusable form fields, file upload handling, and rich text inputs. Describe the role of utility functions in form processing and error mapping. Illustrate the complete form lifecycle: initialization, validation, submission, and error display. Include examples of both simple and complex validation rules, async validations, and conditional fields. Address accessibility features in forms, loading states during submission, and success/error feedback mechanisms. Provide best practices for creating new forms and extending existing validation schemas.

wiki_catalogs.name: Training Checklists
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the Training Checklists feature. Explain its purpose in onboarding new employees through structured checklists and task management. Document the implementation of the plan creation form, checklist display via checklist-card.tsx, and task management using new-task-modal.tsx. Detail how new-hire-table.tsx organizes plans and integrates with employee data from employees.ts service. Include examples of form validation, dynamic task addition, and state persistence. Address common issues such as incomplete checklists and task assignment errors, providing solutions based on actual code patterns. Make content accessible to HR administrators while including technical depth for developers extending the workflow.

wiki_catalogs.name: Layout & Utility Components
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive documentation for layout and utility components that support structural organization and enhanced interactions. Cover resizable panels, scrollable areas, visual separators, hover cards, aspect ratio containers, collapsible sections, accordions, calendars, and carousels. Use page-header.tsx as a key example to demonstrate composition patterns for consistent page layouts. Explain how these components enhance usability in data-intensive interfaces like knowledge-base-table.tsx and org-chart components. Document responsive behaviors, touch support, and performance implications of nested scrolling and dynamic sizing. Include accessibility considerations such as keyboard navigation in accordions and calendar date selection. Provide theming guidance and integration tips with other component categories.

wiki_catalogs.name: Executive Members API Reference
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive API documentation for the Executive Members module. Document the following endpoints: GET /api/executives/executives/ (list), POST /api/executives/executives/ (create), GET /api/executives/executives/{id}/ (retrieve), PUT/PATCH /api/executives/executives/{id}/ (update), DELETE /api/executives/executives/{id}/ (destroy), POST /api/executives/executives/{id}/upload-profile-picture/ (upload), and DELETE /api/executives/executives/{id}/delete-profile-picture/ (delete image). For each, specify HTTP methods, request/response schemas using types from api.d.ts, authentication requirements (JWT via cookies), and error codes. Include examples of request payloads and responses. Explain how these are consumed by the service layer and React Query hooks. Address rate limiting, validation rules, and file size constraints for image uploads.

wiki_catalogs.name: UI Components
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create detailed documentation for the UI component library used throughout the application. Describe the visual appearance, behavior, and user interaction patterns of key components including buttons, cards, tables, modals, and forms. Document props/attributes, events, and customization options for reusable components like card-table, app-modal, and profile-dropdown. Include usage examples with code snippets from actual implementations in the dashboard modules. Provide guidelines for responsive design and accessibility compliance following WCAG standards. Document component states, animations, and transitions implemented with Tailwind CSS and shadcn/ui primitives. Include style customization options and theming support via CSS variables. Address cross-browser compatibility and performance optimization for rendering large tables and lists. Document component composition patterns and integration with React Hook Form and React Query.

wiki_catalogs.name: Org Chart
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the Org Chart module. Explain its role in visualizing organizational hierarchy and managing employee reporting structures. Document the implementation of the interactive chart view, employee profile cards, and table-based data display. Detail the creation and editing flows using org-chart-form.tsx and dynamic routing with [id] parameters. Explain integration with employee data services and use-employees hook for real-time updates. Include examples of drag-and-drop reorganization and hierarchical data rendering. Address common issues such as circular reference detection and performance with large org trees, referencing actual validation and optimization techniques in the codebase.

wiki_catalogs.name: Data Management
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the Data Management system focusing on CRUD operations and state synchronization. Explain the implementation details of data fetching, mutation, and caching using React Query hooks across various entities (departments, executive members, employees). Document the invocation relationship between page components, custom hooks, service functions, and the API client. Detail the domain model for paginated responses, filtering, and sorting mechanisms. Include concrete examples from the actual codebase showing useDepartments, useExecutiveMembers, and other query hooks in action. Explain configuration options for pagination, search, and sorting dropdowns. Address common issues such as stale data, race conditions during mutations, and optimistic updates. Provide solutions for debugging data synchronization problems and monitoring query states. Make content accessible to beginners while providing sufficient technical depth on advanced React Query features like prefetching and infinite queries.

wiki_catalogs.name: Profile
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the Profile feature. Explain its purpose in allowing users to view and manage their personal information within the ERP system. Document the implementation of the profile page, profile-card.tsx component, and integration with authentication context. Detail how user data is retrieved from the employees service and displayed in a read-edit interface. Include examples of avatar handling, personal detail updates, and session synchronization. Address common issues such as stale data after updates and authentication token mismatches, providing solutions based on actual context and service patterns. Make content accessible to end-users while including technical depth on state consistency for developers.

wiki_catalogs.name: Deployment & Configuration
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive content for Deployment & Configuration focused on the build and deployment process of the cartwrightking-admin-erp application. Explain the purpose and configuration options in each key file: next.config.ts (remote patterns, compiler options), tsconfig.json (type checking settings), components.json (shadcn/ui component configuration), and package.json (scripts and dependencies). Provide step-by-step instructions for building the application for production, including environment-specific configurations. Document deployment considerations for different hosting platforms (Vercel, Netlify, custom servers). Include configuration for environment variables, API endpoints, and security headers. Address common deployment issues such as static asset loading, route handling, and hydration errors. Provide performance optimization tips for bundle size reduction and loading strategies. Include monitoring and logging recommendations for production environments.

wiki_overview.content:
<blog>
# Comprehensive Project Analysis: CartwrightKing Admin ERP

## 1. Project Introduction

The CartwrightKing Admin ERP is a comprehensive enterprise resource planning system designed for administrative management of organizational data. Built on the Next.js 15 framework with React 19, this application serves as a centralized dashboard for managing company information, departments, executive members, knowledge base content, new hire plans, and organizational charts.

**Core Goals and Objectives:**
- Provide a secure, authenticated interface for administrative staff
- Centralize management of organizational data and employee information
- Offer intuitive navigation through a well-structured dashboard
- Implement robust authentication and session management
- Enable efficient data visualization and reporting

**Target Audience:**
- Administrative personnel responsible for HR and organizational management
- Executive team members managing company structure and personnel
- IT administrators overseeing system configuration and maintenance
- Onboarding specialists managing new hire processes

Sources:
- [README.md](d:\Projects\cartwrightking-admin-erp\README.md)

## 2. Technical Architecture

### Component Breakdown

The application follows a modern Next.js App Router architecture with a clear separation of concerns. The project is organized into several key directories:

- **`src/app`**: Contains the application routes and layout structure
- **`src/components`**: Houses reusable UI components organized by feature
- **`src/services`**: Manages API communication with the backend
- **`src/hooks`**: Contains custom React hooks for data fetching and state management
- **`src/lib`**: Provides utility functions and core infrastructure
- **`src/contexts`**: Implements application-wide state management

### Design Patterns

The application employs several modern design patterns:
- **Component-Driven Development**: UI components are organized by feature and responsibility
- **State Management**: Uses React Context API for authentication state with custom hooks
- **Data Fetching**: Implements React Query for efficient data fetching and caching
- **Authentication Flow**: Cookie-based authentication with token refresh mechanism
- **Form Handling**: Utilizes React Hook Form with Zod validation

### System Relationships

```mermaid
flowchart TD
  A[Client Browser] --> B[Next.js App Router]
  B --> C[Auth Context]
  C --> D[React Query]
  D --> E[API Services]
  E --> F[Backend API]
  G[UI Components] --> B
  H[Form Validation] --> I[Zod Schema]
  J[State Management] --> K[Custom Hooks]
  C --> L[Cookie Storage]
  E --> M[API Interceptor]
  M --> L
```

### Data Flow

```mermaid
flowchart TD
  A[User Interaction] --> B[UI Component]
  B --> C[React Hook Form]
  C --> D[Form Validation]
  D --> E[Service Call]
  E --> F[API Interceptor]
  F --> G[Backend API]
  G --> H[Response]
  H --> I[React Query Cache]
  I --> J[State Update]
  J --> K[UI Re-render]
```

## 3. Key Implementation

### Main Entry Points
- `src/app/page.tsx`: Home page that redirects based on authentication status
- `src/app/(auth)/login/page.tsx`: Login page component
- `src/app/(admin)/dashboard/page.tsx`: Admin dashboard entry point

### Core Modules
- **Authentication System**: Comprehensive auth flow with token management
- **API Service Layer**: Centralized API communication with error handling
- **Component Library**: Reusable UI components following shadcn/ui patterns
- **State Management**: Context-based authentication state with event listeners

### Configuration Approach
- **Next.js Configuration**: Custom image remote patterns for Unsplash
- **Component Configuration**: shadcn/ui style configuration with aliases
- **Environment Variables**: API base URL configuration with fallback
- **Type Generation**: OpenAPI schema integration for type safety

### External Dependencies
- **Framework**: Next.js 15.5.3, React 19.1.0
- **UI Library**: shadcn/ui components with Radix UI primitives
- **State Management**: @tanstack/react-query for data fetching
- **Form Handling**: react-hook-form with Zod validation
- **Styling**: Tailwind CSS with custom configuration
- **Icons**: Lucide React icons
- **Rich Text**: Tiptap editor for content creation

### Integration Points
- **Backend API**: RESTful endpoints for data operations
- **Authentication**: JWT-based token authentication with refresh
- **Image Hosting**: Unsplash integration for remote images
- **Type Generation**: OpenAPI schema integration for type safety

### Component Relationships

```mermaid
graph LR
  A[App Component] --> B[Auth Context]
  A --> C[Router]
  B --> D[Auth Provider]
  C --> E[Login Page]
  C --> F[Dashboard]
  E --> G[Login Form]
  G --> H[Auth Service]
  H --> I[API Caller]
  I --> J[Backend API]
  F --> K[Admin Layout]
  K --> L[Admin Sidebar]
  K --> M[Admin Topbar]
  F --> N[Dashboard Components]
  N --> O[Stat Cards]
  N --> P[Charts]
```

Sources:
- [package.json](d:\Projects\cartwrightking-admin-erp\package.json)
- [next.config.ts](d:\Projects\cartwrightking-admin-erp\next.config.ts)
- [components.json](d:\Projects\cartwrightking-admin-erp\components.json)
- [src/app/page.tsx](d:\Projects\cartwrightking-admin-erp\src\app\page.tsx)
- [src/app/(auth)/login/page.tsx](d:\Projects\cartwrightking-admin-erp\src\app\(auth)\login\page.tsx)

## 4. Key Features

### Authentication System
The application implements a robust authentication system with token-based authentication, automatic token refresh, and session management. The system uses cookies to store JWT tokens and includes interceptor logic to handle token expiration and refresh.

```mermaid
stateDiagram-v2
  [*] --> Unauthenticated
  Unauthenticated --> Authenticating: Login Attempt
  Authenticating --> Authenticated: Valid Credentials
  Authenticating --> Unauthenticated: Invalid Credentials
  Authenticated --> TokenExpiring: Token Near Expiry
  TokenExpiring --> RefreshingToken: Request New Token
  RefreshingToken --> Authenticated: Token Refreshed
  RefreshingToken --> Unauthenticated: Refresh Failed
  Authenticated --> Unauthenticated: Logout
```

### Dashboard Navigation
The application features a comprehensive dashboard with multiple administrative sections:
- Company Hub for organizational information
- Departments management
- Executive members directory
- Knowledge base with document management
- New hire plan tracking
- Organizational chart visualization
- Employee profile management

### Data Management
The system provides CRUD operations for various entities through a consistent API service layer. Each service module follows the same pattern for list, detail, create, update, and delete operations.

```mermaid
sequenceDiagram
  User->>+UI: Interact with Component
  UI->>+React Query: Request Data
  React Query->>+API Service: Fetch Data
  API Service->>+Backend: HTTP Request
  Backend-->>-API Service: JSON Response
  API Service-->>-React Query: Processed Data
  React Query-->>-UI: Update State
  UI-->>-User: Render Updated Interface
```

### Responsive Design
The application implements a responsive design system using Tailwind CSS with mobile detection hooks. The UI adapts to different screen sizes with appropriate layout adjustments.

### Form Validation
The system uses a robust form validation approach combining React Hook Form with Zod for type-safe validation schemas. This ensures data integrity and provides user-friendly error messages.

Sources:
- [src/components/auth/login-form.tsx](d:\Projects\cartwrightking-admin-erp\src\components\auth\login-form.tsx)
- [src/hooks/queries/use-auth.ts](d:\Projects\cartwrightking-admin-erp\src\hooks\queries\use-auth.ts)
- [src/services/auth.ts](d:\Projects\cartwrightking-admin-erp\src\services\auth.ts)
- [src/lib/api-caller.ts](d:\Projects\cartwrightking-admin-erp\src\lib\api-caller.ts)
- [src/lib/api.ts](d:\Projects\cartwrightking-admin-erp\src\lib\api.ts)
- [src/lib/cookies.ts](d:\Projects\cartwrightking-admin-erp\src\lib\cookies.ts)
- [src/constants/api-routes.ts](d:\Projects\cartwrightking-admin-erp\src\constants\api-routes.ts)
- [src/contexts/auth-context.tsx](d:\Projects\cartwrightking-admin-erp\src\contexts\auth-context.tsx)
</blog>
